front.text:
<for> At the start of the investigator phase: The investigators as a group must choose and play one card from Alice's hand. Then, you may move Alice to any connecting location.
<reaction> When you would discover any amount of clues, even if your location has no clues on it: You may place that many of your clues on Gurathnaka instead.
<obj> If there are more clues on Gurathnaka than it has remaining health, advance.
front.flavor_text: Though the void draws the shadows and last vestiges of Alice's dream, Gurathnaka resists its pull, its continued howls reverberating in your bones. Its indescribable voice speaks to a primal fear within you, but the only way to survive this nightmare is to banish the Eater of Dreams.

back.name: Call it a Night
back.text:
Amid the rushing vacuum of the darkness through the wavering fissure, Gurathnaka claws at Arkham greedily. Each time you repel the monster, drawing from your recent experiences to weaken its grip through the dimensions. Alice focuses every fiber of her will on maintaining stability while you unravel the portal and sever Gurathnaka's attachment to Arkham. Weary minutes pass, until finally, a breakthrough! The shadowy abomination falls through the endless void, still reaching toward you with empty hunger. "It's through!" Alice cries, though you cannot make a reply before the rift sutures itself shut, and a ripple bursts forth from the point of exit, knocking you off your feet.
(5)

front.text:
Alice Liddell cannot take control of the Cheshire Cat.
Enemies cannot engage, attack, or target Alice Liddell when moving via the hunter keyword.
<for> At the end of the enemy phase: Move Gurathnaka one location towards the location with the most investigators.
<for> If Alice is defeated, (<res>2</res>).
front.flavor_text: The stability of Arkham continues to degrade as it had when you first entered Wonderland. Darkness spreads from the north half of the city, and with it, Gurathnaka and its minions. Shadows greedily consume everything in their path like a forest fire, gorging and growing steadily stronger.

back.name: Psychological Warfare
back.text:
Alice leans against a partially demolished building as another ungodly roar rips through the air. Her efforts are slowing the shadows from crossing over into Arkham, but her body and spirit are being quickly overtaxed.
Deal 1 damage or 1 horror to Alice. If resolving this effect would defeat Alice: (2).

front.text:
Alice Liddell cannot take control of the Cheshire Cat.
Enemies cannot engage, attack, or target Alice Liddell when moving via the hunter keyword.
<for> At the end of the enemy phase: Move Gurathnaka one location towards the location with the most investigators.
<for> If Alice is defeated, (<res>2</res>).
front.flavor_text: Gurathnaka leads its shadows in consuming any and all material they can claw apart; animal, vegetable, or mineral. A dark void radiates out in their wake, emptier even than the void of space.

back.name: The Mind Recoils
back.text:
Reality wavers and ripples inconstantly, unbalancing you in its shifting state. You rise quickly, but Alice takes several more moments to push herself unsteadily back up. If the shadows grow in strength much further, then Alice may not survive the strain.
Deal 2 damage and/or horror to Alice. If resolving this effect would defeat Alice: (2).

front.text:
Alice Liddell cannot take control of the Cheshire Cat.
Enemies cannot engage, attack, or target Alice Liddell when moving via the hunter keyword.
<for> At the end of the enemy phase: Move Gurathnaka one location towards the location with the most investigators.
<for> If Alice is defeated, (<res>2</res>).
front.flavor_text: The fading glow of twilight and the few remaining street lights in Arkham light your way as you hurry as never before. When darkness overtakes the city, it will be the end not only for you, but all life on Earth.

back.name: The Dead of Night
back.text:
The sharp popping and shattering of glass sounds over the rumble of the crumbling landscape. With all now artificial light gone, you can only watch in despair as the fading glow of twilight darkens to night and the shadows claw at you from all sides.
Each investigator who has not resigned is defeated.

back.subtitle: Smooth Sailing
back.flavor_text: The waters of the Miskatonic have receded, though the surface still churns with each ripple of reality.

back.name: Miskatonic University
back.subtitle: Reeducation
back.flavor_text:
The university's ivy halls have returned 
and reordered, but the invasive darkness 
still pervades the campus grounds.

stonework that you recognize from the Queen of Hearts' castle.

back.name: French Hill
back.subtitle: The Heart of Society
back.flavor_text:
French Hill once again sits in its usual splendor, 
though its gambrel roofs rattle with the 
rumbling throughout the city.

front.illustrator: Illus. Nele Diel & Alex van der Linde

back.name: Uptown
back.subtitle: The Same Old Haunts
back.flavor_text:
Arkham's woods unravel and twist back 
into their familiar but foreboding forms, 
giving you little peace of mind.

Southside's quiet roads are cluttered with 
silverware, crockery, and half-eaten refreshments 
from the Tea Party table.

back.name: Southside
back.subtitle: Tea and Sympathy
back.flavor_text: Southside once again sits in quiet seclusion, in stark contrast to the roiling chaos just north of it.

Despite its proximity to the breach between the two worlds,
Easttown is relatively untouched by the chaos.

back.flavor_text: Easttown has always been considered one of the safer districts due to the police presence, but in these circumstances, it's just as vulnerable as the others.

Remnants of the earlier chaos still linger in Northside. They may be the key to fully closing off 
the connection to Wonderland.

back.flavor_text: When you left Northside behind in your journey to Wonderland, you weren't sure if you'd ever see it in a recognizable state ever again.

A wide tear in reality hovers far above the city.
Wind rushes in toward it, but only the 
invading shadows seem to be affected by its pull.

front.flavor_text: You question the strange cat, but it speaks in circular logic and nonsensical terms. You get the feeling that it is testing you rather than helping you. If you want actual answers on how to stop Gurathnaka, you'll have to scour the city and watch the changes up-close.

back.name: New Neighbors
back.text:
The cat appears again on a tree limb just above you, grinning as ever. "Truth is far more true when found than told," it purrs, "but the shadows are growing long. Don't you think it's time you went home? Not your home, of course, but Alice's. It's in the neighborhood, you see."
Put the set-aside Abandoned House into play. The lead investigator must immediately take control of the set-aside The Cheshire Cat (Grinning Guide) card. Shuffle the set-aside Cheshire Cat encounter set into the encounter deck.

front.text: <obj> After an investigator enters the Abandoned House, advance.
front.flavor_text: Amid the chaotic overlap of this other world, an English country house has appeared in the neighborhood just south of you. If what the cat suggested is true, then the key to stopping these worlds from merging lies inside.

back.name: The Way In
back.text:
You open the door to the quaint house and step inside hesitantly. The rooms are mostly bare, and what little furniture remains is covered with dusty white sheets. The whole search seems more futile by the moment until you enter a room whose only furnishing is a large mirror on the mantle above a fireplace. Curiously, the mirror's surface ripples intermittently, and through it you can see an entirely different room. As you approach for a closer look, the scratching of paws on the old wooden floor directs your attention back to the hall behind you. A white rabbit dressed in old Victorian clothing dashes away, clutching a pocket watch and mumbling to itself. You won't get a chance to investigate both before Arkham unravels completely.
The investigators must decide (choose one): We have to find out what that rabbit is up to. Put the set-aside The White Rabbit into play at Abandoned House. Advance to Act 3a -- Follow the White Rabbit. We have to figure out how to get inside that mirror. Put the set-aside The Looking-Glass into play at Abandoned House. Advance to Act 3a -- Through the Looking-Glass.

front.text: <obj> If there are at least 3<per> clues on this act, advance.
front.flavor_text: The white rabbit seems to have the one thing you're looking for amid the constantly twisting landscape: purpose. If there's any method to this madness, you'll find it wherever the rabbit is headed.

back.name: Down the Rabbit Hole
back.text:
Following the rabbit is no easy task. It moves rapidly through the unstable terrain without sparing a moment to notice you. You nearly lose track of it in a thick tangle of bushes, but finally catch a glimpse of the rabbit leaping down a hole. You approach the rabbit hole in exasperation, wondering how to proceed, but as you stand there, the hole slowly widens to a much larger and seemingly bottomless pit. You look to the cat for advice, but it merely grins, waiting for you to act. Foolish as it seems, you steel your nerves and leap into the pit.
(1)

front.text:
<for> At the end of the round, if there are no clues on locations: Place 1<per> clues on Abandoned House from the token bank.
<obj> After each undefeated investigator has resigned, advance.
front.flavor_text: If there's anything that's clear about the state of Arkham, it's that Wonderland is the source of it. If you're going to have any real chance of stopping the chaos, you'll have to get to that world through the mirror.

back.name: Proceeding Backward
back.text:
You slowly begin to notice patterns in the distortions sweeping over Arkham. There are moments when the boundaries between the two worlds weaken. You spend some time learning the rhythm and quirks of the distortions before returning to the abandoned house. With proper timing, you leap forward as the mirror's surface ripples, and you pass through it completely as if diving through water.
(2)

front.flavor_text: Strange waves of distortion sweep over Arkham, devolving it quickly into chaos. The city is rapidly being warped and blended with the Wonderland of Alice's dreams. Buildings and landmarks distort into unfamiliar forms, while the people unfortunate enough to be caught in these ripples are likewise distorted. You hope that you can find some way to stop or reverse these changes before you yourself are transformed by the events.

back.name: What Dreams May Come
back.text:
The city is coming apart at the seams, while shadowy creatures further unravel it by consuming anything they can tear apart. Buildings collapse as their bricks turn into ivory dominoes, street lamps pop and blossom like daisies, and the very ground shifts like a rug on a polished floor. As distortions grow stronger, you wonder if the changes can possibly be reversed.
Choose the Arkham location that is closest to Arkham Asylum that does not have the Wonderland trait. Flip that location to its Wonderland side and place 1 clues on it. Each investigator at that location takes 1 damage and 1 horror. If each Arkham location in play also has the Wonderland trait, each investigator who has not resigned is defeated and suffers a physical or mental trauma (your choice). Otherwise, flip this agenda.

front.subtitle: Semblance of Sanity
front.text: <action>: Heal 1 horror (limit once per turn).
front.flavor_text:
The asylum doesn't have the greatest track record of actually curing their patients. You hope that 
you won't have to leave Alice here for very long.

back.name: Arkham Asylum
back.subtitle: Gone Mental
back.text: <for> At the end of the round, deal 1 horror to each investigator at <name>.
back.flavor_text:
Splotches of color and bizarre structures coil 
around the gothic building, pressing in on all sides 
and merging haphazardly. You can't hazard 
a guess at just what they might be.

front.subtitle: Fun in the Sun
front.text: Investigators at <name> get +2 skill value on all tests made on or against cards with the <t>Shadow</t> trait.
front.flavor_text:
The spacious square has few landmarks, due to its popularity as a meeting place, and is largely deserted 
in the early evening, leaving it wide open.

back.name: Independence Square
back.subtitle: Long Night Ahead
back.text: Investigators at <name> get –2 skill value on all tests made on or against cards with the <t>Shadow</t> trait.
back.flavor_text: Dark trees twist upward out of the ground, transforming the open park into a dense tangle of forest. Their boughs mesh together as they grow, blotting out the glow of sunset.

front.subtitle: Capital Ideas
front.text: <reaction> When you take the resource action: gain an additional resource (limit once per turn).
front.flavor_text: The bank is nearing its closing hours. Citizens and tellers alike are hoping to hurry through their business, even without the jumbled mess blossoming around the building.

back.name: Bank of Arkham
back.subtitle: Unstable Market
back.text: Investigators at <name> cannot gain resources.
back.flavor_text:
The streets around the bank rise up jaggedly, 
cutting into the masonry and spreading like a forest fire. The shapes hardly seem natural, 
but branch off as if alive and growing.

front.subtitle: Pressing Matters
front.text: <reaction> When you take the draw action: Draw 1 additional card (limit once per turn).
front.flavor_text: The Arkham Advertiser's staff are frantically at work, cataloguing the strange events sweeping over Arkham. Few of their reporters have returned with information, if any.

back.name: Newspaper Office
back.subtitle: Irregular Opening
back.text: Investigators at <name> cannot draw cards.
back.flavor_text: The checkered tile floor of the newspaper office bends and spirals around you, while chess pieces slide in and around with chaotic, but deliberate motion in a whirling display.

front.subtitle: Oddities for Cheap
front.text: <action> Spend 1 resource: Search the top 6 cards of your deck for an <t>Item</t> or <t>Spell</t> card and draw it. Shuffle your deck.
front.flavor_text: The shop of habitual oddities seems almost part of the mad transformations outside. The shop is silent but for the muted ticking of a clock on Oliver Thomas' desk.

back.name: Curiositie Shoppe
back.subtitle: Time is Money
back.text: <for> At the end of the round, each investigator at <name> discards the top card of their deck. If that card is a weakness, draw it.
back.flavor_text:
The once-quiet ticking amplifies intensely as 
clock faces and ratcheting gears begin to bleed through 
the various display cases of the shop.

front.subtitle: Sticking to Schedule
front.text: <reaction> When you would play an asset: Reduce that asset's cost by 1 (to a minimum of 1, limit once per turn).
front.flavor_text: Northside's train station buzzes with activity and excitement as the setting sun continue to lower. Though it was the first site of Alice's incident, it is currently furthest from its nexus.

back.name: Train Station
back.subtitle: Gotten Off-Track
back.text: <for> When you would play an asset: Increase that asset's cost by 1.
back.flavor_text:
As the city twists around you, so do the careful 
network of railway tracks flowing in and around 
the station. Boxcars and engines alike lift and begin to propel themselves on this rollercoaster formation.

front.flavor_text: The oyster demands that you take it with you. "The shadows are hungry, like their master. And anything hungry can be baited. They crave things from your world, some of which have drifted in from the sea of tears." You get the idea pretty quickly to start collecting anything you can find from Arkham.

back.name: Catch of the Day
back.text:
With the wise oyster's guidance, you gather a collection of random flotsam at a small ledge overlooking the sea of tears. "These items are not from Wonderland either," the oyster explains matter-of-factly, "and therefore must be from wherever you are from. The shadows crave things from your home, and with this many, you surely have enough to bait a hook." You tie the debris together and hurl it into the water on a line. No sooner has the cluster hit the water when an enormous shadowy figure erupts from the sea, consuming the objects in a single bite. Bill the lizard gives a terrified wail at the mere sight of the beast, and you do your best to keep him from fleeing as the monster emerges.
Check the Campaign Log. If the investigators went down the rabbit hole, spawn the set-aside Deep Lurker (Perilous Predator) at Rocky Outcropping. Otherwise, spawn the set-aside Deep Lurker (Ravenous Ravager) at Rocky Outcropping.

front.text: If you are at Deep Lurker's location, spend 1 clue: Fight. This action targets Deep Lurker and uses instead of . If there are 4 or more oysters on your location, this attack deals +1 damage. If Deep Lurker is defeated, advance.
front.flavor_text: The shadowy monster eyes you hungrily and begins to scrabble up the cliff face toward you. Now is your chance to see what weaknesses the greater shadows hold.

back.name: High and Dry
back.text:
You beat back the savage monster, throwing everything you have at it. After many grueling minutes, the shadowy creature grows unstable, and dissipates with a hollow cry. Bill the lizard's courage finally fails him, and he lets out a panicked yelp. He flees immediately at the awful sound of the shadow's death rattle, leaving you to face its fading form alone.
(2)

front.flavor_text: The quiet lapping of waves on the sand does little to calm your feeling of foreboding. Shadows flit in every wave, making you reluctant to enter the surf in search of the truth.

back.name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
back.text:
"Problems with the old country house, squire?" A disinterested carpenter approaches the White Rabbit and his partially demolished home, giving them both only a glance. "Yes, yes, only hurry!" the rabbit pleads, tapping his foot. "Easy does it, guv," the carpenter retorts, rubbing his stomach, "Job's as good as done, only I'm a mite peckish. I'll be back 'round once I've had a bite." Further down the rocky coast, an enormous walrus lifts itself out of the surf. Its stomach growls like an earthquake as it looks out over the sea of tears. "Victuals abound. An oyster dinner seems the only solution," it rumbles to itself.
Spawn the set-aside The Walrus into play at Tidal Pools. Spawn the set-aside The Carpenter into play at White Rabbit's House. Shuffle the remainder of the Walrus and Carpenter encounter set and the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck.

front.text:
<for> At the end of the mythos phase, remove all doom from all cards in play. For each doom removed, resolve the highest possible option 1<per> times:
<bullet> Move 1 oyster from The Walrus or The
 Carpenter's location onto that enemy.
<bullet> Move The Walrus or The Carpenter one
 location towards the closest location with the
 most oysters on it.
<for> If there are no oysters on locations, advance.
front.flavor_text: The two hungry figures make their way down the beach with the clear intent of devouring the oysters. With each bite, they seem to grow larger by inches at a time, and at the same time grow darker and more distorted.

back.name: They'd Eaten Every One
back.text:
The Walrus and the Carpenter devour the oysters one by one with hardly a pause between them, towering over the beach as they grab oysters by ever-growing handfuls. As the pair gulps down the last of the poor creatures, shadows explode out of them, tearing their bodies to shreds and scoring the coast in the same way that the White Rabbit's house had been destroyed. You flee inland, barely evading the spreading darkness.
Each undefeated investigator who has not resigned takes 1 mental trauma from witnessing the horrific event. (1)

front.text: Consult the Chair Locations section in the campaign guide for additional movement options. While The Dormouse is in play and not controlled by any investigator, he gains: " Spend 2 clues as a group: Parley. Take control of The Dormouse. For the remainder of the scenario, The Dormouse does not take up any slots." If an investigator controls The Dormouse, advance.
front.flavor_text: You lift the lid and try to shake the Dormouse awake, but he remains in a deep sleep. Perhaps something at the table here could rouse him. You'll have to pick carefully, however. There's no telling what could be in each teapot or cup.

back.name: Tea and Sympathy
back.text: You find the one cup of tea with a much more pleasing aroma than the others and hold it up to the Dormouse's nose. He stirs lightly at first, then awakens at once with a loud gasp. Panic overtakes him until he sees you looking down at him with concern. "You're... you're here to help...?" he asks you with a quaver in his voice. You nod, and he nods quickly in return. "Help at last... good, good. The things prey on dreams, even within a dream. If you fall asleep, you're as good as a fish in a pot. We've got to drive these shadows away, but we have to anchor the table and chairs back to Wonderland."

front.text:
Consult the Chair Locations section in the campaign guide for additional movement options.
<action> If you are at a <t>Chair</t> location: Test <willpower> (X), where X is total shroud of your location and each connecting <t>Chair</t> location. You may spend any amount of clues as a group to get +2 <willpower> per clue spent. If you succeed, place a horror token on your location and each connecting <t>Chair</t> location, as tethers. Locations with tethers cannot leave play or be moved by card effects.
<obj> If each <t>Chair</t> location has a tether on it, advance.
front.flavor_text: "You've got to tether the chairs at once," the Dormouse commands, "find a way to anchor each one, and the table will return with it." You look back around the table and wrack your brain for a way to accomplish exactly that.

back.name: Grounded in Fantasy
back.text:
In each chair, you try to direct your memories towards your adventures in Wonderland thus far. Each image you conjure and event you replay seems to banish a small patch of darkness under each seat. You continue around the table until at last, a ring of grass surrounds the tea party. As if severed, the shadows retreat, and slowly the Hare's garden fades back into vision.
If the current 'c' agenda is The Mad Tea Party, 2. If the current 'c' agenda is The Mad March Hare, 3. If the current 'c' agenda is The Mad Hatter, 4. If the current 'c' agenda is An Uncontrolled Party, 5.

front.text:
Only one investigator or enemy can occupy a <t>Chair</t> location at once.
Consult the Chair Locations section in the campaign guide for further details.
All enemies lose all spawn instructions and gain "<spawn> Any empty <t>Chair</t> location."
front.flavor_text: The swirling shadows have isolated you on the tea party table and the many chairs orbiting it, none of which seem particularly stable. You will have to work quickly if you are to find your way back to solid ground.

back.name: Not Your Cup of Tea
back.text:
As the chairs cycle in and out, to say nothing of the crazed partygoers that keep appearing at the table, you do your best to avoid being dragged down into the shadows below you. The table grows steadily more raucous as the occupants guzzle down the questionable-looking tea.
Heal 2 damage each from The Hare and The Hatter.

front.text:
Only one investigator or enemy can occupy a <t>Chair</t> location at once.

All enemies lose all spawn instructions and gain "<spawn> Any empty <t>Chair</t> location."
front.flavor_text:
Each time the chairs float away from the table, they seem to sink further and further from you. If this keeps up, you may soon run out of footing.
<vs>

back.name: Drink and Be Merry
back.text:
The tea party guests guzzle down their drinks and stuff their faces with any bits of food they can reach as they keep up their nonsensical conversation. This madness is going to get you all killed, if they don't snap out of it.
Heal 2 damage each from The Hare and The Hatter.

front.text:
Only one investigator or enemy can occupy a <t>Chair</t> location at once.
Consult the Chair Locations section in the campaign guide for further details.
All enemies lose all spawn instructions and gain "<spawn> Any empty <t>Chair</t> location."
front.flavor_text:
The sparse light illuminating the tea party table is fading fast. If you don't find a way out before the darkness envelops you, there's no telling if you'll ever see daylight again.
<vs>

back.name: Death of the Party
back.text:
Whatever force was holding the tea party table afloat cannot oppose the grasping shadows any longer. The table and chairs fall away from you, and you can't prevent yourself from falling into darkness.
Each undefeated investigator takes 1 mental or physical trauma (your choice) from being taken by the shadows. (1)

front.text: Doom cannot be placed on this agenda. Spend 1 clues: Resign. You leap into the shadows, trusting your intuition. If The Hare or The Hatter is defeated, advance.
front.flavor_text: The Hare and Hatter seem quite content to continue their festivities amid the chaos, though they react wildly to any perceived violations of etiquette. They are not only unaware of the shadows, but seemingly unaffected by them as well. What role they have in keeping the tea party afloat is unclear, but you had best proceed with caution in any case.

back.name: Party Foul
back.text:
If The Hatter was defeated:
The Hatter gives a distressed gurgle and slumps down in his chair as your final blow strikes him. Instantly, the Hare draws upward in a fury and points an accusing finger at you. "If you're going to roughhouse then do it away from the table! I won't have you distressing the other guests!"
Flip The Hare. Remember that the investigator who defeated The Hatter "has terrible table manners." Advance to Agenda 2c -- The Mad March Hare. If The Hare was defeated:
The Hare collapses limply onto the table as your final attack makes its mark. The Hatter hurls a half-filled teacup at you, utterly livid. "Now you've done it! A perfectly stimulating conversation ruined by your hooliganism! If you can't be civil, then you shouldn't speak at all!"
Flip The Hatter. Remember that the investigator who defeated The Hare "has terrible table manners." Advance to Agenda 2c -- The Mad Hatter.

front.text: Doom cannot be placed on this agenda. Spend 1 clues: Resign. You leap into the shadows, trusting your intuition. If The Hare is defeated, advance.
front.flavor_text: The Hare's anger at the death of his friend drives him into a feral state. Nothing you can say or do placates him in the slightest. You will have to continue your attempts at grounding the tea party with this new wrinkle.

back.name: Splitting Hares
back.text:
The Hare tumbles out of his seat, grasping upward feebly as he vanishes into the darkness below. The whole table shudders, rattling the dishes as the shadows close inward on you.
Remember that the investigator who defeated The Hare "has terrible table manners." Advance to Agenda 3c -- An Uncontrolled Party.

front.text: Doom cannot be placed on this agenda. Spend 1 clues: Resign. You leap into the shadows, trusting your intuition. If The Hatter is defeated, advance.
front.flavor_text: The Hatter is so infuriated by the death of his companion that he can hardly speak, and he stares at you with malice clear in his eyes. You will have to continue your investigations despite his state of fury.

back.name: Hanging Your Hat
back.text:
The Hatter falls to his knees with a small wail before plummeting down into the roiling shadows. With his disappearance, the darkness seems to close in on you, and the table shakes with a creak of timbers.
Remember that the investigator who defeated The Hatter "has terrible table manners." Advance to Agenda 3c -- An Uncontrolled Party.

front.text: Doom cannot be placed on this agenda. Spend 1 clues: Resign. You leap into the shadows, trusting your intuition. At the start of the mythos phase, if there are no enemies in play: Place 1 doom on the 'a' agenda.
front.flavor_text: With the Hare and Hatter deceased, the floating tea party grows increasingly unstable. Shadowy tendrils reach in from all sides, attempting to drag the chairs and table apart. You had best make these next minutes count.

back.name: You're Wasting Time!
back.text:
<center>What are you looking at this side for?
There are more important things you ought to be doing.
Flip this agenda.

front.flavor_text: The old man's headgear resembles a samovar, and he pours himself a cup of tea by bowing his head forward.

front.flavor_text: `I told you butter wouldn’t suit the works!’

front.title: <unique> <name>
front.subtitle: Slumbering Storyteller
front.text:
Your maximum hand size is increased by 1.
<reaction> After you draw a non-weakness card from your deck, exhaust <name>: Shuffle that card back into your deck and draw another card.
front.flavor_text:
Dreams within dreams, 
and none of them quite making sense.

front.text: <obj> If 1<per> or more <t>Restricted</t> locations are revealed, you must advance.
front.flavor_text: The Queen of Hearts seems likely to decapitate everyone in sight if this theft isn't cleared up. First thing's first however, namely getting access to the crime scenes to clear your name. How easy that would be if you weren't the current primary suspect in all this.

back.name: Friends in High Places
back.text: You manage to ingratiate yourself with the queen's court enough for the guards to ease up on their restrictions. Now that you have access to the more closely-guarded parts of the castle, you can finally make some progress on tracking down the culprit. However, a greater problem has risen to light during your initial scouting of the castle. Shadowy creatures lurk in the darker recesses of the castle, and often found wherever crumbs of the tarts lie scattered. If Gurathnaka's minions are going to attack the castle, they certainly are biding their time.

front.text: <obj> Only investigators at Hedge Maze may spend the requisite number of clues to advance.
front.flavor_text: While the queen's cronies have been quick about locking down the castle, they certainly haven't been thorough at their investigations. Between the missing tarts and the lurking threat of the shadows, finding the thief seems to be the key to both mysteries.

back.name: Caught Red-Mouthed
back.text:
In a lonely branch of the hedge maze, you are finally able to locate the thief - the Knave of Hearts, as you might have expected. He sits on the grass with half a plate of tarts beside him and some red smudges at the corners of his mouth. Your approach startles the Knave, and he quickly stands to appraise you. "You are neither guard nor card. Good, you can assist in my plan. The tarts were a start, but the Queen must be driven into a greater fury." He leans in toward you to whisper, but keeps a bit of distance still. "I've seen shadowy creatures lurking in the darkest corners of the palace. You've seen them too, haven't you? I know what they can do to people, and I've no desire to follow suit. The trouble is, I can't get at them. Only intense emotions seem to draw them out out of hiding. The Queen's rage should be bait enough, but she must be in a state of rage like never before. I can vandalize the castle to provoke her, but I shall need your assistance."
Put the set-aside The Knave of Hearts into play at Hedge Maze.

front.text:
<action> If you are at The Knave of Hearts' location, spend 1 clue: Place 1 damage token on your location and move The Knave of Hearts to a connecting location.
<reaction> After you defeat an enemy: Place 1 damage token on your location.
<reaction> After The Queen of Hearts enters a location, if there is any amount of damage tokens on that location: Remove all damage tokens from that location and place an equal amount of horror on The Queen of Hearts.
<obj> If there is 3<per> or more horror on The Queen of Hearts, advance.
front.flavor_text: The Knave may not be the most trustworthy person you've met, but the threat of Gurathnaka's shadows consuming the palace has forced your hand.

back.name: Stay of Execution
back.text:
Your attempts at provoking the Queen's short temper reach immediate success. Between your direct interference and the Knave's expert sabotage of the castle, the Queen of Hearts has been pushed past her limit. "OFF WITH ALL OF YOUR HEADS!" she blasts, her face red as her own roses as she begins a tantrum. Shadows shift around the castle, reaching toward the queen in the midst of her meltdown.
(2)

front.text: <for> At the end of the mythos phase: In player order, each investigator who has 7 or more blame on their copy of Royal Suspicion draws an additional encounter card.
front.flavor_text: A case of stolen tarts. You'd laugh if it weren't being pinned on you with the death penalty waiting. The majority of the guards are still allowing you to move about the castle despite the accusations, so you'll have to do your best to not arouse the court's wrath any further.

back.name: Chop Chop!
back.text:
"Haven't you found the culprit yet?! Off with his head!" The Queen's mood is worsening, and the executioner hurriedly sharpens his axe to comply with her wishes.
If The Executioner is in play, place 1 doom on him. Otherwise, search the encounter deck and discard pile for The Executioner and spawn him normally.

front.text:
The Queen of Hearts gains alert.
<for> At the end of the mythos phase: In player order, each investigator who has 7 or more blame on their copy of Royal Suspicion draws an additional encounter card.
front.flavor_text: The Queen stalks the castle grounds on the hunt for a victim. You're beginning to wonder just how much the Queen cares about the tarts, or if she just wants an excuse to execute someone.

back.name: Heads Will Roll
back.text:
Another bellow from the Queen sends the executioner scrambling after you. You've given him the slip a few times already, but he's not about to lose his job over you, or his head for that matter.
If The Executioner is in play, place 1 doom on him. Otherwise, search the encounter deck and discard pile for The Executioner and spawn him normally.

front.text:
The Executioner and The Queen of Hearts gain alert.
<for> At the end of the mythos phase: In player order, each investigator who has 7 or more blame on their copy of Royal Suspicion draws an additional encounter card.
front.flavor_text: If this keeps up, the whole castle will soon be after your head. If you don't make these next few minutes count, then there won't be a chance to redeem yourself.

back.name: Next on the Chopping Block
back.text:
The sheer number of card guards cut off every possible avenue of escape. Cornered against stone walls with your resources depleted, you stare grimly as the Queen and her executioner approach. "There can be no doubt! Off with their heads this instant!"
Each investigator who has not resigned is defeated.

front.flavor_text:
Buckets and brushes lie abandoned by the white rose bushes. 
If the queen is as passionate about her roses as she was 
about her tarts, then you might be able to get in her good 
graces by doing a bit of impromptu gardening.

back.flavor_text: The royal gardens bristle with bright red flowers of every variety, though you notice a small section of rose bushes that glisten and drip with a coating of red paint.

front.text: <action>: You try to impress the courtiers to get them on your side. Test <combat> or <agility> (3). If you succeed, remove 1 blame from your copy of Royal Suspicion. If you fail by 2 or more, add 1 blame to your copy of Royal Suspicion instead.
front.flavor_text:
A small group of the queen's courtiers play croquet 
on the open terrace, albeit with flamingos and rolled-up hedgehogs instead of mallets and balls.

back.flavor_text:
The sounds of laughter coming from the grounds mix
with the squawks and squeaks of distressed animals.
Just what sort of games are being played here?

front.text: <action>: You try to give directions to one of the lost courtiers. Test <willpower> or <intellect> (3). If you succeed, remove 1 blame from your copy of Royal Suspicion. If you fail by 2 or more, add 1 blame to your copy of Royal Suspicion instead.
front.flavor_text:
Several members of the royal court amble about the maze, 
utterly lost but too proud to admit it. Perhaps you could gain their favor by helping them out of the labyrinth.

back.flavor_text:
With how difficult Wonderland has been to navigate,
you can only guess how much more frustrating a
deliberate maze would be.

The Queen's gardeners are awaiting execution forlornly, but patiently.

she has accused of thievery.

front.flavor_text:
If you need to get out of danger quickly,
the Knave might be around or he might not be.

front.text:
Investigators at any location may activate The Bellman's abilities.
<action> If there is no horror on your location, spend 1<per> clues as a group: Place a horror token on that location (from the token bank).
<obj> When The Snark enters play, advance.
front.flavor_text: Despite the magnitude of the task and the inexperience of the other hunters, there seems to be some promise of success. All that remains now is to chase the trails wherever they may lead.

back.name: Trail's End
back.text: "Snark ahoy!" the Bellman hollers, "if it should prove no Boojum, then after it with haste!" You hurry toward the commotion and finally catch your first real glimpse of the Snark. Its appearance strikes you as being rather plain compared with the majority of Wonderland's other odd creatures. Could this really be the beast whose talents you need to escape these darkening woods alive?

front.text:
Investigators at any location may activate The Bellman's abilities.
<action> If there is no horror on your location, spend 1<per> clues as a group: Place a horror token on that location (from the token bank).
<obj> When The Snark enters play, advance.
front.flavor_text: Despite the magnitude of the task and the inexperience of the other hunters, there seems to be some promise of success. All that remains now is to chase the trails wherever they may lead.

back.name: Trail's End
back.text: "Snark ahoy!" the Bellman hollers, "if it should prove no Boojum, then after it with haste!" You hurry toward the commotion and finally catch your first real glimpse of the Snark. Its appearance strikes you as being rather plain compared with the majority of Wonderland's other odd creatures. Could this really be the beast whose talents you need to escape these darkening woods alive?

front.text: Investigators at any location may activate The Bellman's abilities. If you are at The Snark's location: Parley. Test any skill (4). If you succeed, place a token on The Snark from the token pool according to the skill used: If you used : 1 horror. If you used : 1 clue. If you used : 1 damage. If you used : 1 resource. If you fail, move The Snark to a connecting location. If there are 2 total tokens on The Snark, you must immediately advance.
front.flavor_text: "Now's our chance!" the Bellman bellows, "Seek it with thimbles, seek it with care! Pursue it with forks and hope! Threaten its life with a railway-share! Charm it with smiles and soap! Only vary your methods, or the Snark may grow suspicious!"

back.name: O Frabjous Day!
back.text:
You try every tactic you can to lure the Snark into capture. After minutes of half-hearted interest, the strange creature finally calms enough for you to approach and lay hands on it. "Masterfully snatched, Bodyguard!" the Bellman cheers, clanging his bell to gather the scattered expedition around.
(2)

front.text: Take 1 physical trauma and 1 mental trauma: Resign. You break away from the search and hope to find the trail out.
front.flavor_text: Despite the enthusiasm of the Bellman and his party, you have some reservations about searching through these woods in the dark. You get the unsettling feeling that as you search for the Snark, something far stranger and far stronger hunts for you.

back.name: An Awful Burbling
back.text:
The Tulgey Wood reverberates with a horrible noise, an indescribable hissing, gurgling, roaring sound. You don't have to ask what sort of monster could make that noise as you see it hurtling through the woods toward you. It is an enormous loathsome thing with fiery eyes and razor-sharp claws that rend trees apart as it passes. Fear courses through your veins and you have scant seconds to decide whether to run or fight.
Search all play areas and out of play areas (including the victory display) for The Jabberwock and move it to the lead investigator's location. Shuffle the remainder of the set-aside Jabberwocky encounter set into the encounter deck.

front.text: Take 1 physical trauma and 1 mental trauma: Resign. You break away from the search and hope to find the trail out.
front.flavor_text: "It's the Jabberwock!" the Bellman cries, and rings his bell in wild alarm. The warning doesn't help you in the slightest however, as you are already in the throes of battle with it. The monster swoops and vanishes in its wild attacks, making you wonder just where and when it will strike next. You try to keep up the search while accounting for this added menace, but the Jabberwock's attack has drawn the attention of much darker beings.

back.name: Hast Thou Slain the Jabberwock?
back.text:
The fiendish creature attacks with increasing frequency and fervor as you attempt to scour the Tulgey Wood. No matter where you turn, the Jabberwock's burning eyes and vicious claws are there to meet you. Even your best attacks leave you wondering if the beast can actually be killed at all.
Search all play areas and out of play areas (including the victory display) for The Jabberwock and move it to the lead investigator's location. If The Jabberwock entered play from the victory display, place 2 damage on it.

front.text: Take 1 physical trauma and 1 mental trauma: Resign. You break away from the search and hope to find the trail out.
front.flavor_text: Even without accounting for the menace of the Jabberwock, the expedition's hopes are rapidly dwindling. The motley hunters cower in fear while the Bellman proudly declares that the Bodyguard will see them through yet. You have every intention of doing so, but the growing darkness and ravenous beasts of the wood may prove otherwise.

back.name: Eight Bells
back.text:
As the Snark hunters grow more separated in their pursuit, the Bellman attempts to keep the group's morale in check. The bell clamors and clangs, but by now, all it can do is attract the attention of the many shadows drawn by the Jabberwock's attack.
Each investigator who has not resigned is defeated.

You'll have to repurpose several of 
your supplies to explore here.

back.flavor_text:
The tall grass forms rings around rocky openings in 
the ground, each leading down several yards.

front.text: <action> If there is no horror on <name>: Discard 1<per> skills from among all investigators' hands at this location. Place a horror token on <name> (from the token bank).
front.flavor_text:
Scaling the top of the mound will take 
no little amount of skill.

back.flavor_text: A large hill rises out of the woods, covered on all faces by a network of stony outcroppings and ledges.

front.text: <action> If there is no horror on <name>: Discard 1<per> events from among all investigators' hands at this location. Place a horror token on <name> (from the token bank).
front.flavor_text:
Fully exploring the valley 
will take quite a bit of maneuvering.

back.flavor_text: This part of the wood sinks in a deep crevasse, scarcely big enough for a single person to walk down the center of.

front.text: Your attention is finally drawn to the Baker, who shouts without restraint and waves his arms wildly. "It's a Snark! Callooh! Callay! Our quarry is finally in sight!" The Baker's confirmation sounds too good to be true. Seeing as you've scoured the rest of the Tulgey Wood, however, if a Snark can be found here at all, then the Baker's proclamation might be believed. If there is exactly 1 location without horror on it: Flip this card and put it into play.

back.name: The Snark
back.subtitle: Puzzling Prey
back.text:
Aloof. 
<spawn> Location without horror on it.
The Snark cannot be engaged, damaged, or defeated.
back.title: <unique> <name>

front.text: "The Snark has cut and run," the Butcher declares, "We've sent it packing, and so it must have returned to its pack." You don't recall anything about Snarks being social creatures, but you are drawn to a nearby grove by a jumble of strange sounds. If there are exactly 2 locations without horror on them: Flip this card and put it into play.

back.name: Lonely Backwoods
back.subtitle: The Butcher's Trail
back.text: If there is no horror on Lonely Backwoods: Search the encounter deck and discard pile for 1 enemy that does not have surge (2 instead if there are 3 or 4 players) and draw it. Place a horror token on Lonely Backwoods (from the token bank).
back.flavor_text:
The Butcher's detour passes by a hollow tree 
occupied by a variety of agitated creatures.

front.text: "I tailed the Snark, but mine fell flat," the Beaver grumbles, holding its flat tail, "Its own tail must be frought with danger." The woods are already filled with danger, but at the Beaver's insistence, you proceed toward a shadowy and isolated valley. If there are exactly 2 locations without horror on them: Flip this card and put it into play.

back.name: Lonely Backwoods
back.subtitle: The Beaver's Trail
back.text: If there is no horror on Lonely Backwoods: Search the encounter deck and discard pile for 1 treachery that does not have surge (2 instead if there are 3 or 4 players) and draw it. Place a horror token on Lonely Backwoods (from the token bank).
back.flavor_text:
The Beaver's directions lead to
a particularly dark and dismal chasm.

front.text: "The Snark must be somewhere deep and lonely," the Barrister speculates, "Or it would have answered the summons I sent it." You're not certain of the Snark's ability to read at all, but the strange noises emanating from a nearby cavern give reason enough to search it. If there are exactly 2 locations without horror on them: Flip this card and put it into play.

back.name: Lonely Backwoods
back.subtitle: The Barrister's Trail
back.text: If there is no horror on Lonely Backwoods: Search your deck and discard pile for a weakness and draw it. Place a horror token on Lonely Backwoods (from the token bank).
back.flavor_text:
The Barrister's course winds through
a claustrophobic series of tunnels.

front.text: "The Snark resists all attempts at bribery," the Banker muses, "and therefore must be found at the bank of a river." You doubt the connection, but the watery footprints you find along the river are proof enough to continue the chase here If there are exactly 2 locations without horror on them: Flip this card and put it into play.

back.name: Lonely Backwoods
back.subtitle: The Banker's Trail
back.text: If there is no horror on Lonely Backwoods: Spend a total of 3 resources from among all investigators' resource pools at this location. Place a horror token on Lonely Backwoods (from the token bank).
back.flavor_text:
The Banker's pursuit ends at the banks of
a dangerous series of river rapids.

front.text: "We must search both high and low," the Broker declares, "but let us start low for the sake of our stock." Though the premise is flawed, this still leads you toward soft mud and bent plants that betray the passage of some creature very recently. If there are exactly 3 locations without horror on them: Flip this card and put it into play.

back.name: Rough Hinterlands
back.subtitle: The Broker's Trail
back.text: If there is no horror on Rough Hinterlands: Discard cards with total cost of 3 from among all investigators' hands at this location. Place a horror token on Rough Hinterlands (from the token bank).
back.flavor_text:
The Broker's track treads over marshy ground
that severely limits your options.

front.text: "It's taken our cue," the Billiard-Maker bemoans, dusting off his hands, "and so it will want chalk to dust the tip, from somewhere rocky, I presume." His theory seems far-fetched at best, but you can't deny the trail of white powder leading down the rocks. If there are exactly 3 locations without horror on them: Flip this card and put it into play.

back.name: Rough Hinterlands
back.subtitle: The Billiard-Maker's Trail
back.text: : If there is no horror on Rough Hinterlands: Test any skill (3). This test gets +1 difficulty. If you succeed, place a horror token on Rough Hinterlands (from the token bank).
back.flavor_text:
The Billiard-Maker's chase requires you to bridge
a vast canyon by whatever means you can.

front.text: "No arrangement could be made to satisfy the beast!" the Bonnet-Maker despairs, "If it refuses a bonnet, then it must be indoors!" You hold your tongue at the notion, but the echoes of some strange beast from a secluded cave cause you to reconsider. If there are exactly 3 locations without horror on them: Flip this card and put it into play.

back.name: Rough Hinterlands
back.subtitle: The Bonnet-Maker's Trail

back.flavor_text:
The Bonnet-Maker's path leads to 
the entrance of a deep and eerie cave.

front.text: "We've bared our soles in this chase," the Boots grumbles, staring at a hole in his shoe, "And yet the Snark hasn't worn out its own shoes. It must be climbing instead." The assumption doesn't seem quite right to you, though you spot movement atop a nearby cliff. If there are exactly 3 locations without horror on them: Flip this card and put it into play.

back.name: Rough Hinterlands

back.flavor_text:

a small ledge atop a sheer cliff face.

front.flavor_text: To end the pointless war between Tweedledum and Tweedledee and get that rattle, you're going to have to be creative, especially if you don't want to just kill one of them. Unfortunately, the massive amounts of cards and chess pieces recruited by the Tweedles are bogging down any plans you've devised.

back.name: Need-to-Know Basis
back.text: The twins' armies are almost as evenly matched as they themselves are. Every soldier of theirs that you cut down swings the balance of the battle in the favor of the other. However, with fewer soldiers blocking your movements, you can focus on figuring out how to bring an end to the battle.

front.text: <obj> Only investigators at Overgrown Dell may spend the requisite number of clues to advance.
front.flavor_text: As the battle drags on, the shadows initially banished by the rattle have begun to creep back toward the valley. You think on the childish personalities of the Tweedles and their old nursery rhyme, and you wonder if you can somehow focus the shadows to scare them out of their duel.

back.name: A Pound of Feathers
back.text:
At first it seems to be impossible to corral the shadows toward any specific part of the battlefield. However, on the sloped terrain around the battlefield, you find several fallen crow feathers that seem to draw nearby shadows toward them. You gather as many as you can find and collect them in the central valley. Within minutes, darkness begins to coalesce around the bundle of feathers and expand into an enormous shape. You take several steps back and cover your ears as the unearthly cawing of an unnatural crow screams out from the growing darkness. Tweedledum and Tweedledee stop barking orders at their minions and stand in frightened awe as the shadowy crow takes shape.
Put the set-aside Monstrous Crow into play next to the agenda deck.

front.text: If you are at the same location as Tweedledum or Tweedledee: Parley. Test or (4). If you succeed, place 1 horror on an uncontrolled story asset at your location. If Tweedledum (Terrified Twin) and Tweedledee (Terrified Twin) are both in the victory display, advance.
front.flavor_text: The Tweedles are already panicking, but still attempting to marshal their troops into action. With the shadowy crow bearing down on the battlefield, you have the tool you need to scare some sense into the twins.

back.name: Eating Crow
back.text:
The Tweedles' nerves were failing them at the crow's appearance, but your added fearmongering sends them screaming and scrambling away from the battle. Without their leaders, the cards and chess pieces have no further driving force, and amble away from the valley harmlessly. Satisfied, you grab the last discarded piece of the rattle and turn your attention up to the shadowy crow.
(5)

front.text:
<for> When a <t>Card</t> enemy is defeated: Place 1 damage token on the scenario card (from the token bank).
<for> When a <t>Chess</t> enemy is defeated: Place 1 horror token on the scenario card (from the token bank).
front.flavor_text: Acting on the Tweedles' orders, the cards and chess pieces clash with each other on every available point in the small wooded valley. At the rate this battle is escalating, the soldiers might actually kill one of the Tweedles before you can get the rattle.

back.name: Tit for Tat
back.text:
With the slight shifting of the flow of combat, one of the soldiers gets an opportunity to storm the opposing hill and attack the dismayed twin on it.
Count the damage and horror tokens on the scenario card and resolve the following: If there are more damage tokens on the scenario card than horror tokens and Tweedledum is in play: Deal 1 damage to Tweedledum. If there are more horror tokens on the scenario card than damage tokens and Tweedledee is in play: Deal 1 damage to Tweedledee. Otherwise: Deal 1 damage to either Tweedledum or Tweedledee (choose one in play). If no resolution was reached through this effect, remove all tokens from the scenario card. Then, flip this agenda.

convince them to give up this ridiculous duel.

back.flavor_text: Fallen logs and tangling weeds collect at the bottom of this small valley. This doesn't seem to deter the cards and chess pieces marching down from the opposing hills.

back.flavor_text: Tweedledum stands atop this hill, looking angrily out across the valley toward his brother with his arms folded.

down into the central valley. You may not be able

<action>: Move an unengaged <t>Chess</t> enemy according to its movement rules in the campaign guide.

front.flavor_text:
You can barely make out the silhouette of the Red King's castle amid the darkened clouds ahead of you. It will be quite an ordeal to make it across the ruined half of the chess board fields.
<vs>

back.name: King's Castle
back.text:
Through the swirling darkness, you charge up the steps of the red castle and burst through the towering double doors. The Red King sits at the opposite end of a grand hall, seated languidly in a grand skeletal throne. He does not make any motion as you enter, though the shadows leaking out of his hooded cloak begin to pour with increasing volume.
Check the Campaign Log. If the investigators went through the looking-glass, spawn the set-aside The Red King (Obscure Overlord) at Eighth Row. Otherwise, spawn the set-aside The Red King (Tenebrous Tyrant) at Eighth Row. If The Red Queen is not in play or in the victory display, spawn her at Eighth Row.

front.text:
<action>: Move an unengaged <t>Chess</t> enemy according to its movement rules in the campaign guide.
<obj> If The Red King is defeated, advance.
front.flavor_text:
The Red King utters no commands or cries of alarm, but his minions pursue you into the castle as the shadows try to blot the light out behind you. Your only recourse is triumph, here and now.
<vs>

back.name: Pawn Takes King
back.text:
You strike the Red King with every bit of courage you can muster, and all at once, the red pieces freeze and the shadows' advance halts. The entire area seems suspended in time for a moment before the king slips down out of his throne and splays on the floor before you.
(2).

front.text:
<t>Chess</t> enemies gain hunter and "<spawn> Seventh Row or Eighth Row."
<for> When a <t>Chess</t> enemy would resolve the hunter keyword, consult the Chess Movement section in the campaign guide.
front.flavor_text: Your arrival on the front lines spurs movement from the far side of the board. If any truce was maintained until now, the time for it has passed.

back.name: Blitz Chess
back.text:
Your preparations to cross the center line have been carefully observed. The red pieces storm out from the darkened castle. You have noticed from the first attackers that the pieces still somehow obey what you would consider normal chess rules. Is the Red King still guiding their movements? Or is it such a core part of the pieces that they move instinctively?
Search the encounter deck and discard pile for a King's Shadow and spawn it at the lead investigator's location. Shuffle the encounter deck if it was searched.

front.text:
<t>Chess</t> enemies gain hunter and "<spawn> Seventh Row or Eighth Row."
<for> When a <t>Chess</t> enemy would resolve the hunter keyword, consult the Chess Movement section in the campaign guide.
front.flavor_text: The battle on the chess fields continues with increasing fervor. Red pieces flow out from the darkened half of the board with surprising speed to meet your approach.

back.name: Gardez la Reine
back.text:
The red pieces pause their fighting to bow and kneel as an imposing figure emerges from the shadowy veil. The Red Queen, her face somehow both hard and soft at once, gazes hatefully across the fields at you as power swells within her. Shadows pour from her robes, and she begins to mutate further. "Strike down the invaders!" she bellows, racing toward you with tremendous speed.
If The Red Queen is not in play or in the victory display, spawn her at Eighth Row.

front.text:
<t>Chess</t> enemies gain hunter and "<spawn> Seventh Row or Eighth Row."
<for> When a <t>Chess</t> enemy would resolve the hunter keyword, consult the Chess Movement section in the campaign guide.
front.flavor_text: As the Red Queen advances upon you, the shadows spread with the speed of a wildfire toward the white castle. Darkness begins to claw at the sky, and each piece of landscape appears like a blackened copy of itself.

back.name: Domination
back.text:
The red army relentlessly presses back against your charge in a seemingly unending flow of soldiers. As they push back, the amassed shadows sweep past you towards the castle of the white chess pieces and crash against it like a tidal wave. Your fighting for conquest turns to a fight for survival as you flee the battlefield.
Each undefeated investigator who has not resigned takes 1 physical trauma from fighting off the red army. (1)
